abstract: Performs the multiply operation *y += alpha * Ax* on a vector of single-precision, floating-point values.

declaration.code: func SparseMultiplyAdd(_ alpha: Float, _ A: SparseMatrix_Float, _ x: DenseVector_Float, _ y: DenseVector_Float)

overview:
## Discussion

Use this function to multiply a scalar by a sparse matrix, then by a dense vector, and accumulate the result. The following equation is an example of a matrix-vector multiplication where the matrix is sparse:



Call [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/SparseMultiplyAdd(_:_:_:_:)-3oa6n] to calculate the result.

items.description: Performs the multiply operation *y += Ax* on a vector of double-precision, floating-point values.
